content:

We are fixing this bug while implementing the latest validator custody spec (the one of this week).

author: manunlp
content:
Currently, when the cgc increases, Prysm tries to subscribe to new subnets and find peers in these subnets.
Only when peers are found, Prysm considers corresponding new data columns as needed to declare the block as available.
After reflexion, I think it kind of defeat the purpose of validator custody, because is no peers are never found in the new subnets, then these new columns won't never be needed to declare the block as available.

I also understand that, when new validators are added, the node needs some time to subscribe to new subnets and find peers in these subnets (if not already the case). So, when new validators are added, requiring immediately to receive new columns to declare the block as available may be too hard.

Question to clients: What do you currently implement in such a case?
New columns are immediately required? New columns are required after a reasonable delay? New columns are required when enough peers are found? Other?
